info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 5:37PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Flathead County through 615 PM MDT... At 536 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Columbia Falls, or 8 miles north of Evergreen, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, brief heavy rain, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia Falls, West Glacier, Apgar, Martin City, Coram, Hungry Horse and La Salle. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 125 and 158, and near mile marker 160. Highway 93 between mile markers 117 and 121. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
